intro: Turrillia, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen shrubs with small, leathery leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. They play an important role in ecological systems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
